summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

The WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE structure defines the format of waveform-audio data for formats having more than two channels or higher sample resolutions than allowed by WAVEFORMATEX. It can also be used to define any format that can be defined by WAVEFORMATEX.

member.name: WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE.dwChannelMask
member.summary: Bitmask specifying the assignment of channels in the stream to speaker positions.

member.name: WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE.SubFormat
member.summary: Subformat of the data, such as KSDATAFORMAT_SUBTYPE_PCM. The subformat information is similar to that provided by the tag in the WAVEFORMATEX structure's wFormatTag member.

member.name: WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE.Format
member.summary: WAVEFORMATEX structure that specifies the basic format. The wFormatTag member must be WAVE_FORMAT_EXTENSIBLE. The cbSize member must be at least 22.

member.name: WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE.Samples
member.summary: A union describing the sample format.

member.name: WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE.Samples.wValidBitsPerSample
member.summary: Number of bits of precision in the signal. Usually equal to WAVEFORMATEX.wBitsPerSample. However, wBitsPerSample is the container size and must be a multiple of 8, whereas wValidBitsPerSample can be any value not exceeding the container size. For example, if the format uses 20-bit samples, wBitsPerSample must be at least 24, but wValidBitsPerSample is 20.

member.name: WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE.Samples.wSamplesPerBlock
member.summary: Number of samples contained in one compressed block of audio data. This value is used in buffer estimation. This value is used with compressed formats that have a fixed number of samples within each block. This value can be set to 0 if a variable number of samples is contained in each block of compressed audio data. In this case, buffer estimation and position information needs to be obtained in other ways.

member.name: WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE.Samples.wReserved
member.summary: Reserved for internal use by operating system. Set to 0.
